column1: Takayasu arteritis is an inflammation of the aorta and its major branches.
The aorta is the artery that carries blood from the heart to the rest of the body.
The disease occurs mainly in children and women younger than 40.
- Decreased radial pulses (at the wrist) - Difference in blood pressure between the two arms - High blood pressure (hypertension) There may also be signs of inflammation (pericarditis or pleuritis).

Tests: - Arteriogram - Angiogram - Complete blood count (CBC) - C-reactive protein (CRP) - Electrocardiogram (ECG) - Erythrocyte sedimentation rate (ESR) - Magnetic resonance angiography (MRA) - Magnetic resonance imaging (MRI) - Computed tomography (CT) - Ultrasound - X-ray of the chest
Biologic agents including TNF inhibitors such as infliximab are recommended for people who do not improve with the previous treatment.
Call your health care provider if you have symptoms of this condition.
